files.description: Defines the intake checklist structure including a new required 'primary_source_verification' section with machine-validated fields and constraints.
Provides the standardized 2019–2025 primary-source verification search-plan template to which intake fields are mapped.
Implements dataclass-based models and validation for the intake checklist and the 2019–2025 search-plan template with clear error reporting.
Implements deterministic mapping from intake 'primary_source_verification' inputs into the standardized 2019–2025 search-plan template fields.
Provides robust YAML load/save utilities with path canonicalization and schema-friendly error messages for configuration files.
Command-line tool that reads an intake checklist YAML, validates required primary-source fields, maps them into the 2019–2025 search-plan template, and outputs a filled search-plan YAML.

missionDescription: Add a 'Primary-source verification' section to the intake checklist with required fields (dataset name/DOI/link; if unknown, research area + candidate authors/keywords) and map these fields to a standardized search-plan template (2019–2025).
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Defines minimum viable inputs for primary-source verification (claim text + dataset identifier/link/DOI or at least research area + optional authors), which can be encoded as required/optional fields ...
